Package model

Class Appointment

java.lang.Object
model.Appointment
public class Appointment extends Object
Appointment Class is developed to manage appointment data imported from the appointments table in the client_schedule database Setters are not defined because all item changes and additions are intended to be managed in the database not the objects.

    • Appointment

      public Appointment(int aptId, String aptTitle, String aptDescription, String aptLocation, String aptType, Timestamp aptStartDateTime, Timestamp aptEndDateTime, Timestamp aptCreationDate, String aptCreatedBy, Timestamp aptLastUpdatedDate, String lastUpdatedBy, Integer customerId, Integer userId, Integer contactId, String contactString)
      Sets reference variables used to refer to Appointment class constructor.
      Parameters:
      aptId - The appointment ID imported from the appointments table in the client_schedule database
      aptTitle - The appointment title imported from the appointments table in the client_schedule database
      aptDescription - The appointment description imported from the appointments table in the client_schedule database
      aptLocation - The appointment location imported from the appointments table in the client_schedule database
      aptType - The appointment type imported from the appointments table in the client_schedule database
      aptStartDateTime - The appointment start date and time imported from the appointments table in the client_schedule database
      aptEndDateTime - The appointment end date and time imported from the appointments table in the client_schedule database
      aptCreationDate - The appointment creation date and time imported from the appointments table in the client_schedule database
      aptCreatedBy - The appointment created by string imported from the appointments table in the client_schedule database
      aptLastUpdatedDate - The appointment last updated date snd time imported from the appointments table in the client_schedule database
      lastUpdatedBy - The appointment last update by string imported from the appointments table in the client_schedule database
      customerId - The appointment customer id imported from the appointments table in the client_schedule database
      userId - The appointment user id imported from the appointments table in the client_schedule database
      contactId - The appointment contact id imported from the appointments table in the client_schedule database
      contactString - The appointment contact name string

    • getAptsByDay

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getAptsByDay(LocalDate date)
      Getter for returning all appointments for a passed in day. Lambda Expression: I used a lambda expression here to improve the readability of my for loop reducing potential bugs in the code. This expression is also more concise meaning there is slightly less code required to perform the same function which will make my code easier to maintain.
      Parameters:
      date - Passed in date for the date filter.
      Returns:
      Returns an ObservableList containing all appointments for a passed date.

    • checkForAptByTime

      public static void checkForAptByTime()
      Checks for appointments occurring withing 15 minutes of the time executed. Room for improvement: Converting this logic to use epoch second could drastically reduce its complexity.

    • getAptsByWeek

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getAptsByWeek(LocalDate date)
      Gets an ObservableList of all appointments with start dates forward one week from the date executed. Lambda Expression: I used a lambda expression here to improve the readability of my for loop reducing potential bugs in the code. This expression is also more concise meaning there is slightly less code required to perform the same function which will make my code easier to maintain.
      Parameters:
      date - Start date for the one week filter.
      Returns:
      Returns an ObservableList containing all appointments occurring forward one week from the passed in date.

    • getAptsByMonth

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> getAptsByMonth(LocalDate date)
      Gets an ObservableList of all appointments with start dates forward one month from the date executed. Lambda Expression: I used a lambda expression here to improve the readability of my for loop reducing potential bugs in the code. This expression is also more concise meaning there is slightly less code required to perform the same function which will make my code easier to maintain.
      Parameters:
      date - Start date for the one month filter.
      Returns:
      Returns an ObservableList containing all appointments occurring forward one month from the passed in date.

    • getDatabaseApts

      public static void getDatabaseApts()
      Pulls a query of all appointment items in the appointment table from the client_schedule database then creates appointment objects for those items. Produces an error prompt if unable to retrieve data from the database.

    • remeoveApt

      public static void remeoveApt(int id)
      Removes an appointment from the appointment table in the client_schedule database. Produces an error prompt if unable to remove the appointment from the database.
      Parameters:
      id - Appointment ID for appointment to be removed.

    • insertApt

      public static void insertApt(int aptId, String aptTitle, String aptDescription, String aptLocation, String aptType, Timestamp aptStartDateTime, Timestamp aptEndDateTime, String aptCreatedBy, String aptlastUpdatedBy, Integer customerId, Integer userId, Integer contactId)
      Commits changes or creates new appointments in the appointments table of the client_schedule database. Produces an error prompt if unable to retrieve data from the database.
      Parameters:
      aptId - Appointment id integer
      aptTitle - appointment title string
      aptDescription - appointment description string
      aptLocation - appointment location string
      aptType - appointment type string
      aptStartDateTime - appointment start date and time timestamp
      aptEndDateTime - appointment end date and time timestamp
      aptCreatedBy - appointment created by username string
      aptlastUpdatedBy - Date and time appointment was last updated as a timestamp
      customerId - appointment customer id as an integer
      userId - appointment user id as an integer
      contactId - appointment contact id as an integer
